title: 107_hr2845
content: Payment of benefits for the month of recipient's death. The amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to old-age insurance benefits and wife's insurance benefits, such as adjusting the ending month for benefits and redesignating subparagraphs. The amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to husband's and child's insurance benefits, including adjusting ending months for benefits and redesignating subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust ending months for widow's and widower's insurance benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust ending months for widow's and widower's insurance benefits, including changes related to remarriage and death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust ending months for widow's and widower's insurance benefits, including changes related to remarriage and death. Amendments include adjustments to Disability Insurance Benefits, Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals, and Exemption From Maximum Benefit Cap. Exemption From Maximum Benefit Cap is added to Section 203 of the Social Security Act. Exemption from maximum benefit cap under Section 203 of the Social Security Act applies without regard to benefits received in the month of an individual's death. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for deaths occurring after 180 days from the enactment date.
